snippet: A partial skull from the Cretaceous period suggests that the crocodile had a bulging shield of thickened skin on its forehead and was considerably bigger than its modern counterpart.
abstract: Dr Casey M Holliday and Nick Gardner study, published in journal PLoS One, reports the discovery of fossils of the Shieldcroc, previously unknown ancestor of the modern crocodile that lived during the Cretaceous period.
lead_paragraph: A partial skull from the Cretaceous period suggests that the crocodile had a bulging shield of thickened skin on its forehead and was considerably bigger than its modern counterpart.

headline.print_headline: A Giant Crocodile Roamed With Dinosaurs
headline.seo: Fossilized Skull of Giant Crocodile From Cretaceous
headline.main: A Giant Crocodile Roamed With Dinosaurs
